Referencias: ^ In full, the "Royal Commission appointed to inquire into the monetary and banking systems at present in operation in Australia"^ The total sum is 200% because each currency trade always involves a currency pair; one currency is sold (e.g. US$) and another bought (€). Therefore each trade is counted twice, once under the sold currency ($) and once under the bought currency (€).
